wikipedia_page.main: John Hodgkiss (ca.1820 – 23 June 1897) was a politician in the early days of the Colony of South Australia

link_mentions.page: Members of the South Australian Legislative Council, 1865–1869
response: || John Hodgkiss || 1866–18721878–1884 || Feb. 1877 || filled vacancy September 1866

Parkin was a native of Glastonbury, near Barnstaple, and emigrated to South Australia on the Recovery, arriving in September 1839. He operated a drapery on Hindley Street (later the site of Miller Anderson's) then at 30 Rundle Street, next to the Globe Hotel, with G. W. Chinner (There are parallels with fellow-parliamentarian John Hodgkiss.)
